title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Macbook came in with the costumer not naming one clear cause. The fan spins for 1 second then turns off,  it's taking 25mA not entering S4 state. Here I have some measurements.

PP5V_S4RS3 = 0V
PP3V3_S4 = 0.31V
PP3V3_S4SW_SNS = 0.01V
PP3V3_S4_TBTAPWR = lowering to 0V

Thinking about replacing TPS51980 but since the fan does spin for a short second I think it is an active short somewhere which makes it get to S0 and then stop.

Is replacing TPS51980 then still my best bet or does this fan activity point to something I overlooked?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: No short on PP3V3_S4 pin on the TPS51980 EN present and VIN present. Maybe short on PP3V3_S4 since the voltage is 0.31V instead of 3.3V?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Fan is powered from 5V_S0, so more S0 voltages should pulse at least (in that second).
Check for pulse at all big coils.
Also check all power rails from pages 57/58.
Where is no pulse, check diode mode to ground...

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Checked around, all big diodes had pulses and when I came acros PP3V3_S4 it turned on. Now pulling 300-500 mA. Something around DCIN board not connected properly?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Board should turn on without LIO flex connected; did you try?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
It turns on after I first pressed the power button, then release then press again for long enough to make the backlight come on (releasing when hearing the chime makes the mac shutdown directly)

it is also very slow, will try to install new os via pendrive today, but the above behaviour looks like an SMC issue. Already tried SMC reset, is checking a sensor a good idea? (no high fan though)

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Did you try PRAM reset?
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

Disconnect trackpad and see if starts normal using R5115/16 pads instead of power button.

You can try clean ME BIOS, just in case.

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Tried Pram reset, got a big white flash, this is something I have not experienced before so maybe it's not what it is supposed to do
Original magsafe 2 charger with power brick attatched and one connected to power supply with 19.5V 2A

Disconnecting trackpad and using the pads gives the same behaviour

Cleaned the ME no result, will flash new bios today

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: new BIOS and still the Mac is very slow and has weird startup issues as mentioned before. It also looks to shutdown when it should go to sleep

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Try another LIO board/flex and trackpad board/flex.
Also remove internal SSD and try USB macOS.

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: replacing all 4 boards/flexes does not change anything. Now trying to use USB macOS, but it has had a full loading bar for 4+ hours now. Also the slowness is noticable before entering any os. Also in the Catalina Installer for instance

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Did you clean ME region correctly for sure?
Can you load Linux, or Windows Live USB?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Cleaned after flashing your BIOS clean ME

will try now!

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Ubuntu live USB looks normal, not slow or anything

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Closing the lid still makes it shutdown. Powering on takes one normal press till the fan stops spinning, then one long ~5second press until the chime comes and the backlight turns on. I can only release the power key after the backlight turns on, releasing on chime makes it shutdown again.

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Since USB and SSD are both equally slow, is it possible that the SMC is the culprit here?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message:
Try first removing R1921.
If still low, change SMC...

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: after removing R1921 is gives 0.05V, something to worry about? its not low as in 0 but also not 0.9 or 3.3

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Did you try to start Apple Diagnostics at boot?

title: 820 00165 fan spins for 1 second then turns off, taking 25mA not entering S4 state
message: Have not tried it after removing the resistor. Before removing the resistor it gave no issues
